sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An ansvver to mis-led Doctor Fearne. According to his own method of his book [brace] Sect. 1. 2. The divinity being by Scripture Sect. 3. 4. 5. The reason by Aristotle Sect. 6. 7. The sense or matter of fact by witnesse [brace] examined. Herle, Charles, 1598-1659.
[4], 38, [2] p.
s.n.], [London : Printed the second weeke of Ianuary. 1642. [i.e. 1643]
Attributed to Charles Herle by Wing. A reply to: Ferne, H. The resolving of conscience, upon this question. The words "Sect. 1. 2. .. by witnesse" are enclosed in brackets on title page. The last leaf is blank. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Jan: 10th at London". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
